stream_context.summary: Kaze works on the Western-themed desert/train level (internally Course 12). Main task: finishing a new Bandit enemy that steals Mario’s coins and drops the final Yoshi Coin of the stage. Stream also includes fixes to train paths, particle despawn, and other polishing needed before declaring the level “content-complete.”

development_findings.summary: Implemented “Bandit” enemy: approaches Mario from behind, subtracts coins from inventory, reacts when spotted, then flees along a pre-defined path.
development_findings.quote: This guy basically he steals your coins and if you catch him stealing your coins, he basically says no and then he will run off.

development_findings.summary: Easter-egg branch: if player has zero coins, the Bandit pities Mario and spawns a Yoshi Coin instead of stealing.
development_findings.quote: If you have no coins here, he should say something like, wow, you're broke… Here's a Yoshi coin for you.

development_findings.summary: Yoshi Coins replace traditional 100-coin stars; five per level grant a star and are designed to reward creative environmental interaction, inspired by Super Mario Sunshine’s coin shines.
development_findings.quote: I think people would hate them less if you didn't have to get them in one go… that’s how I want the Yoshi coins to work as well.

development_findings.summary: Course 12 is effectively content-complete; remaining tasks are Zeina’s Bandit animations, a signpost, collision/audio polish, and Biobak’s final graphic passes.
development_findings.quote: After this we're done with the level; all that will be missing is some animations then Zeina's currently working on and the sign.

development_findings.summary: Fixed trains: corrected spline indices and floor-snapping so multiple locomotives now follow tracks without falling or causing lag.
development_findings.quote: Let's see if the trains follow the tracks as we want… there we go, I think we've got it.

development_findings.summary: Optimised Pokey enemy: reduced per-frame ray-casts from 31 down to 1, improving performance.
development_findings.quote: Turns out it's more like 31… I reduced it to one; I think that's a little more reasonable.

development_findings.summary: Particle-despawn bug between area transitions found and patched.
development_findings.quote: Particles do not despawn when you area transition—remind me to fix that… bug was fixed so that's good.

development_findings.summary: Game now contains 410 text boxes—roughly triple the original Mario 64—reflecting expanded narrative and guidance.
development_findings.quote: We have 410 text boxes in this game now—that's almost three times vanilla Mario 64.

development_findings.summary: Resolved persistent GCC ‘note’ about FP registers across threads by changing inline casting; highlighted difficulty of producing a minimal repro for N64 multi-threaded code.
development_findings.quote: Every time I compile the game I get this issue… it's not a warning, it's a note.

context_findings.summary: Kaze is frustrated with StackOverflow culture demanding minimal examples unsuitable for N64 hardware workflows.
context_findings.quote: They want me to make a minimal reproducible example… do you have an N64 so I can give that to you?

context_findings.summary: Expresses pragmatic stance on future projects: may shift to Unreal Engine for an original game due to financial viability despite interest in further OoT hacks.
context_findings.quote: Most likely it will be my own game made in Unreal Engine just 'cause I have to think about the financial aspects as well.

context_findings.summary: Personal finance hurdles: Patreon payments were frozen for 18 months; PayPal funds remain inaccessible, leading him to recommend Ko-fi over Patreon.
context_findings.quote: Any money you send me on Paypal, I can't use it. It's all just frozen in time.

context_findings.summary: Humorous domestic dynamic: Zeina dislikes Kaze’s desire for a buzzcut; light banter on stream.
context_findings.quote: Can someone convince my wife that it's okay for men to just have a buzzcut?… You are annoying.

context_findings.summary: Philosophy on design: wants rewards that encourage exploration, dislikes forced one-sitting 100-coin stars.
context_findings.quote: Tying reward to that hopefully fuels that sense of exploration.

biobak.summary: Still tasked with graphical clean-up on Course 12, including vertex colour fixes and remaining texture work.
biobak.quote: Biobak still has some work to do after.

biobak.summary: Discussed replacing Pokey sprites with smoother geospheres if visual quality can be maintained.
biobak.quote: If you can make it look good, sure, but I have serious doubts about that.

badub.summary: Composing new ‘Western duel’ music, aiming for a hype tone similar to the cave theme.
badub.quote: Badub is also currently making a song for the Western duel scene.

zeina.summary: Responsible for Bandit animation set and the in-level sign; these are final assets needed for Course 12 lock.
zeina.quote: All that will be missing is some animations then Zeina's currently working on and the sign.

zeina.summary: Engages in playful on-stream banter with Kaze about his appearance, reflecting their personal and professional overlap.
zeina.quote: Can someone convince my wife that it's okay for men to just have a buzzcut? … You are annoying.

key_stories.title: StackOverflow Standoff
key_stories.summary: Kaze battles an unhelpful StackOverflow thread while chasing a compiler note tied to N64 multi-threaded FP registers.
key_stories.challenge: GCC emits a cryptic ‘note’ every build; StackOverflow demands a minimal example.
key_stories.process: Explains impossibility of reproducing without N64 tool-chain, experiments with pragmas, eventually fixes cast internally.
key_stories.outcome: Issue silenced; Kaze vents humorously about ‘soft skills’ being the real solution.
key_stories.key_quote: Thanks all of you for your very kind and helpful words… the issue has been resolved by soft skills.

key_stories.title: Designing the Bandit
key_stories.summary: Creation of a coin-stealing Bandit culminates in Course 12’s final Yoshi Coin and sets tone for playful world-building.
key_stories.challenge: Need a memorable mechanic for last Yoshi Coin and varied level pacing.
key_stories.process: Programs stealth behaviour, coin removal, conditional dialogue, easter-egg pity mode, flee path and tumble animation.
key_stories.outcome: Enemy finished except for Zeina’s animations; mechanic reinforces exploration and humor.
key_stories.key_quote: If you have no coins here, he should say something like, wow, you're broke… Here's a Yoshi coin for you.

key_stories.title: Payment Platform Nightmare
key_stories.summary: For 18 months Kaze couldn’t access Patreon or PayPal funds, jeopardising income during development.
key_stories.challenge: Patreon account and PayPal both froze payouts.
key_stories.process: Repeated support tickets; finally Patreon resolved days before tax season while PayPal remains locked.
key_stories.outcome: Advises creators to use Ko-fi; highlights financial strain of fan projects.
key_stories.key_quote: It only took them one and a half years… Any money you send me on Paypal, I can't use it.
